definitions: make a sharp explosive cry characteristic of dogs and other animals
speak or shout in an angry commanding tone often with harsh words
accidentally scrape or rub off skin from a body part against something rough
examples: The guard dog barked loudly at the approaching strangers
Seals bark when they communicate with their colony members
The drill sergeant barked orders at the new recruits
She barked at him to get out of her office
He barked his shin painfully against the coffee table
The child barked her knee when she fell on concrete

definitions: provide soldiers with accommodation in military buildings or quarters
shout loud critical comments or jeers especially at performers or sports players
shout encouragement and support for a team or person during a competition
examples: The army barracks its troops in purpose-built accommodation near the base
They barracked the soldiers in temporary quarters during the exercise
The crowd barracked the referee after the controversial decision
Hecklers barracked the comedian throughout his disappointing performance
Australian fans enthusiastically barrack for their team at every match
She barracks for the local football club every weekend

definitions: attack continuously with artillery fire or bombs over a wide area
direct an overwhelming number of questions or complaints at someone persistently
block or control the flow of water by constructing a dam or barrier
examples: Enemy forces barraged our positions throughout the night with heavy artillery
The military barraged the stronghold before launching the ground assault
Reporters barraged the politician with difficult questions about the scandal
Customers barraged the company with complaints after the service outage
Engineers barraged the river to create a reservoir for the town
They plan to barrage the estuary for tidal power generation
